text:
I just tried in-process mode of Tomcat 3.2.1 with IIS 5.0/Windows 2000. After 
restart IIS, I found inprocess.stdout and inprocess.stderr in my log-directory, 
the contents are shown below:

1. inprocess.stdout:

Starting up StartupThread
Starting tomcat. Check logs/tomcat.log for error messages
Library D:\Progra~1\Tomcat\bin\win32\i386\jni_connect.dll loaded
Running ...
End waiting
Running fine

2. inprocess.stderr:

2001-06-14 02:56:13 - ContextManager: Adding context Ctx( /examples )
2001-06-14 02:56:13 - ContextManager: Adding context Ctx( /admin )
2001-06-14 02:56:13 - ContextManager: Adding context Ctx( /bookstore )
2001-06-14 02:56:13 - ContextManager: Adding context Ctx(  )
2001-06-14 02:56:13 - ContextManager: Adding context Ctx( /test )
Failed to loadLibrary() D:\Progra~1\Tomcat\bin\win32\i386\jni_connect.dll

I don't know what the last line of inproces.stderr means. Something is wrong?
But I can try the example by 
visit "http://localhost/examples/jsp/num/numguess.jsp", why?
creator: liy@intensoft.com
cmanolache@yahoo.com
text: I don't use IIS, but I'll try it with Apache2.0.

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
Bad message... Fail to loadLibrary means using LD_LIBRARY_PATH ( or equivalent )
doesn't work, and it'll try with full path. 

I fixed it in 3.3
